group_1.narration: We were going to make suggestions to the Witches@we found to ensure our well-being…
In the end, however, we only found one.@Much, much fewer than we had been expecting.

group_1.textLeft: Hmm… This isn't going well.

group_1.textRight: Still, I'm glad we found at least one.
What do you wanna do with it?

group_1.textLeft: For now…I guess we should get its Grief Seed?

group_1.textRight: Huh, is that really it?

group_1.textLeft: Actually, I'd wanted to use suggestions to make@it so Witches would come at our beck and call.
Since you unleashed all the Witches at once,@we have to find them again one by one, right?
So you have to decide whether to get their@Grief Seed or to use them for something else.

group_1.textRight: Well, I've been kinda ad libbin' everything.

group_1.textLeft: I don't think our "Let's Ruin Everything Plan"@is going to work if we just play by ear.

group_1.textRight: You're really tryin' to make this name@stick, huh…

group_1.textLeft: That's why it would be good to set things up so@we have one Witch roaming freely through town.
And then when we run out of uses for it…

group_1.textRight: We get the Grief Seed?

group_1.textLeft: Yeah, exactly…!

group_1.textRight: I see…

group_1.textLeft: For now, though, why don't we focus on@gathering Grief Seeds just in case?
And then we'll stow them away in here!

group_1.textRight: …To keep 'em from bein' stolen or something?@I think you're way overthinkin' this, Sena…
But hey, if that's what you want,@then that's what we'll do.

group_1.textLeft: Thank you…

group_1.narration: Despite all I said, what I really wanted@was to gather Grief Seeds…
I…I was scared Hanna would push herself@too hard and become a Witch like me.
I was worried she was going to say something like,@"I ain't gonna use this! I'm gonna go out with a bang!"
…But thankfully she agreed.

group_1.textLeft: …I won't let you become a Witch, Hanna…

group_1.textRight: Hmm? Me, a Witch?

group_1.textLeft: Ah, that's…

group_1.textRight: Alriiight, alriiight!@I won't become a Witch.
'Cause I'm gonna go out with a bang before@that happens!

group_1.textLeft: What?

group_1.textRight: I've done a lot of things already, haven't I?@And I'm gonna keep on doin' 'em.
But I don't think I can become a Witch.
Like, I don't think I'm allowed to.

group_1.textLeft: What are you…saying…?

group_1.textRight: Hmm? I mean, when we go down,@we gotta go out in a blaze of glory!
Otherwise…

group_1.narration: ―Hanna―@Doesn't that basically prove@the world's made up of malice?
―Mikoto―@...
―Hanna―@I grew up surrounded by all kinds@of nasty and absurd things.
―Hanna―@I mean, that kind of shit was happening@right there in the light of day.
―Hanna―@So now, I feel like I've come to represent@that kind of malice.
―Hanna―@And if that's true, then if we win,@doesn't that mean malice conquers all?
―Hanna―@Yeah, I'm sure if that happens…@it'll just go to affirm that's the way life is…
―Hanna―@I don't want that…and if you get stuck@in a place like that, Sena,
―Hanna―@then you're not gonna be reborn.
―Mikoto―@I don't understand what you're saying, Hanna…
―Hanna―@I guess it's too soon for you, huh?@Ahahaha…
―Hanna―@Well, I ain't gonna pull any punches, that's for sure.
―Hanna―@If people try and challenge us, we'll swing right back at 'em.@We'll put everything on the line to prove we're right.
―Hanna―@Prove that no matter what difficulties we face,@people never lose.
―Mikoto―@But Hanna…you're saying you WANT to lose…
―Hanna―@Yeah, 'cause I ain't normal…@I don't have a scrap of hope left.
―Hanna―@No, I take that back…@There's one thing I do have hope for.
―Hanna―@You, Sena.
―Mikoto―@Huh…?
―Hanna―@I ain't gonna let you be erased… Naw, that's not all…@I'll show the world that you ain't just a ghost.
―Hanna―@Yes! We're going to make everyone in this town…@No, this whole goddamn world aware of your existence.
―Hanna―@Everyone's gonna celebrate your new life.
―Mikoto―@...How will you go about that?
―Hanna―@I just need to pull off one little thing I'm planning…@But I'm keepin' the details a secret!
―Hanna―@Birthday presents are supposed@to be a surprise, after all.
After that, whenever I tried to ask,@all I could pry from her was a simple "not telling!"@So all that was left was to look for Witches.
We spent our days searching them out,@and making our suggestions…
And we stayed on top of collecting Grief Seeds.
It was too dangerous to leave them all@in one place, so we hid them in scattered places,@like ruined buildings, in the mountains,@and so many other places.

group_1.textRight: Let's call it quits for today.

group_1.textLeft: Yeah…we've gathered plenty, so we don't need@to be so frantic anymore.

group_1.textRight: Alright, let's head to our digs for today.

group_1.textLeft: …Huh? Here?

group_1.textRight: Noooo, not here! It's just a little way further.

group_1.textLeft: Mm-hmm… Say, why do you always choose@a new place for us to go?

group_1.textRight: …'Cause I don't want to get too attached.

group_1.textLeft: I see. You've thought this through.
…But, this place is…
*Gasp*

group_1.narration: In the public cemetery,@a woman stood before a tombstone.@I recognized her right away.
She's…

group_1.textRight: What's the matter?

group_1.textLeft: Mom…

group_1.textRight: Huh…?

group_1.narration: That woman was my mom.
She looked so heartbroken,@and she was saying something@to that tombstone…
The tombstone that had my name on it.
